intro: Navia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate navia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun or partial shade. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits, and it is also cultivated as an ornamental plant. Navia intermedia is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in coastal environments.
